Key Match Events: Zimbabwe beat India by 13 runs in the 1st T20I on July 6, 2024.
Ravi Bishnoi took 4 wickets for 13 runs, his career-best figures.
Sikandar Raza was named Player of the Match for his all-round performance.
Washington Sundar and Avesh Khan's partnership brought back hopes for India but ultimately fell short.
Blessing Muzarabani and Tendai Chatara bowled crucial overs at the end to secure Zimbabwe's win.
Pre-Game Insights: India won the toss and opted to bowl first.
The match started at 4:30 PM IST on July 6, 2024, at Harare Sports Club, Harare.
Post-Match Reflections: Sikandar Raza expressed happiness about the win but emphasized taking one game at a time.
Shubman Gill mentioned that India bowled well but let themselves down in the fielding department.
Clive Madande shared his strategy to bat through and protect his partner, contributing to Zimbabwe's total.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch had unpredictable bounce and offered turn, making it challenging for the batters.
The crowd support made it feel like Zimbabwe was playing with 12 players.
